definition: to jump out/fig. to appear suddenly
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell/to free oneself from a life of torture
out of the frying pan into the fire (idiom)
pinyin: tiao4 chu1 fu3 di3 jin4 huo3 keng1

sentences.english: Yet one day, she decided to leap out the constrictions of her world.
sentences.chinese: 可是有一天，她決定要跳出這個世界的羈絆。

sentences.english: The Gu way grows startled disgrace, body quickly the Zong jumped behind outside of circle.
sentences.chinese: 賈道長愕然失色，身子急忙後縱跳出了圈外。

sentences.english: Jump out of a plane while still sewing your parachute and you'll get a good sense of pace in this business.
sentences.chinese: 或者說當你還在縫補降落傘的時候就跳出飛機。

sentences.english: It drives me crazy and sometimes I've even thought of jumping out of the car and run!
sentences.chinese: 太讓人抓狂了，有時候我甚至想跳出去跑着算了。

sentences.english: Gradually, the sun, which is like a huge egg, is popping out of the clouds slowly.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地，太陽像一個碩大的雞蛋黃慢慢跳出雲層。

sentences.english: Then suddenly, an idea came into her racing, terrified brain.
sentences.chinese: 但馬上急中生智，一個主意跳出了她快速轉動的腦海。

sentences.english: Sees human one Shan and jump a person, is accurate a recruit a seamless department empty vestige.
sentences.chinese: 只見人影一閃，跳出一個人來，正是一招無痕司空跡。

sentences.english: Out of the frying-pan into the fire.
You need to think creatively— outside the box .
sentences.chinese: 你應該跳出慣有思維方式，去創造性地思考。

sentences.english: Ah, it must have escaped from its cage. It was a free bird!
sentences.chinese: 啊，這是一隻跳出樊籠自由的鳥兒。

sentences.english: One more jump, and he was out of the well.
However, accounts at the time of the event stated that he jumped.
sentences.chinese: 但是，當時對於事件的解釋寫的是他是自己跳出去的。

sentences.english: Can we get out of the glass tower?
sentences.chinese: 我們能跳出那個象牙塔嗎？

sentences.english: And then the second law comes in and says well, that's not quite right.
sentences.chinese: 然後第二定律跳出來說，這不大對頭。

sentences.english: Jump on the bandwagon, if for no other reason than to improve your bottom line.
sentences.chinese: 如果想要提升你的底線，就跳出那些從衆心理吧。

sentences.english: Scooping up the handgun, he bounded outside and held it to the foreman's head.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起手槍跳出車外，把槍口對準工頭的頭。

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to plunge into/to jump into
to rush out
to limit/to confine/to restrict sth within set boundaries
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
shackles/to shackle/(fig.) restraint/yoke
to run out/to escape
to walk into
to rush in/to charge in
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
to leap forward/to make rapid progress/a leap forward
intrinsic to sth/inherent/native
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
to fall back/to go in reverse
